reporting-org.narrative: United Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees in the Near East

description.narrative: In 2020, safeguarding neutrality will remain critical for the continued operational effectiveness and safety of staff, beneficiaries and UNRWA facilities in Gaza. Given the political context and challenges arising from the situation in Gaza, this can involve sensitive issues and provoke strong community reactions requiring continual monitoring, engagement and, where necessary, robust engagement at an installation level. The Agency remains committed to ensuring neutrality in accordance with the Agency’s regulatory framework and standard operating procedures and the UN Humanitarian Principles. Neutrality in Agency installations will be monitored twice a year by field staff. All neutrality issues will be documented and followed up. Issues that are incompatible with the Agency’s neutrality framework that represent a specific concern will be tracked and followed up by senior management.

sector.narrative: Emergency Response/Relief coordination and support services
Protection. There is no cluster for neutrality and access
